name: Author Bio Strip
description: Compact author or contributor information block displaying 1-4 team members with optional headshot, name, title, organization, and brief bio. Typically placed at the end of the document before appendices, or on the inside back cover.

grid.columns: 2-15 (13 columns, centered) or full-width 1-16 for multi-author grid
grid.margins: $spacing-09 (48px) above the bio section, $spacing-07 (32px) between author entries

components: Section heading: $heading-05 in $text-01, typically 'About the Authors' or 'Contributors'
Author card (repeated 1-4 times): self-contained bio unit
Headshot: 64px circular avatar with $ui-03 border, optional placeholder icon if no photo
Optional contact links: $label-01 in $blue-60 for email or LinkedIn
rules: Maximum 4 authors per page — more authors should use a compact list format instead of full bio cards
Author name uses $heading-03 — prominent enough to be scannable but not competing with document headings
Bio text limited to 2-3 sentences in $body-short-01 — this is a credential summary, not a full CV
Headshots are 64px circular with $ui-03 border — consistent sizing across all authors
If headshots are available for some authors but not all, use a Carbon person icon placeholder for consistency
Section heading 'About the Authors' uses $heading-05 — matching appendix-level hierarchy
Author cards laid out horizontally (2 per row for 2-4 authors) or vertically stacked for single author
This section starts on a new page if the previous page has less than 40% remaining vertical space

printBehavior.pagePosition: back-matter — after conclusion, before appendix or on inside back cover

accessibilityNotes: Each author card should use <article> or <section aria-label='Author: Name'> for navigation
Headshot images need alt='Photo of [Name]' — placeholder icons need alt='Author photo placeholder'
Contact links must have descriptive text (not just icons) — e.g., 'Email Jane Doe' not just a mail icon

Bio text should use

elements, not — proper block-level semantics for screen readers
antiPatterns: Never include full CVs or lengthy biographies — 2-3 sentences maximum per author
Never use inconsistent photo sizes or shapes — all headshots must be 64px circular or all must be placeholders
Never place author bios before the document's conclusion — they belong in back-matter (after conclusion, before appendix)
Never list more than 4 authors with full bio cards — use a compact name-and-title list for larger teams
Never omit the author's organizational affiliation — name + title + organization is the minimum for professional credibility
